revision.text: {{Article history|action1=GAN |action1date=22:59, 11 July 2012 |action1link=Talk:Siege of Mantua (1799)/GA1 |action1result=listed |action1oldid=501793719 |dykdate=17 June 2008 |dykentry=... that after agreeing to a [[prisoner exchange]] following the 1799 '''[[Siege of Mantua (1799)|Siege of Mantua]]''', the [[Imperial and Royal Army during the Napoleonic Wars|Austrians]] reneged by arresting soldiers of the [[Polish Legions (Napoleonic period)|Polish Second Legion]] as "[[deserter]]s"? |views=1826 |currentstatus=GA |topic=war }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Austria|class=GA|importance=Mid}} {{WikiProject France|class=GA|importance=Mid}} {{WikiProject Italy|class=GA|importance=Mid}} {{WikiProject Poland|class = GA | b1 = yes | b2 = yes | b3 = yes | b4 = yes | b5 = yes | b6 = yes |importance = low}} {{WikiProject Military history|class=GA |B-Class-1=yes |B-Class-2=yes |B-Class-3=yes |B-Class-4=yes |B-Class-5=yes |French=yes|German=yes|Polish=yes|Napoleonic=yes}} }} ==Source?== Pracically, the whole article is based on this source: * {{pl icon}} Various authors, ''Obrona Mantui'', Chwała Oręża Polskiego 14 (35), Rzeczpospolita, 23 October 2006 (publication contains a map). [http://rzeczpospolita.pl/dodatki/bitwy_061028/ Online version] Can we find out anything about the ''scholarly'' credentials of any authors? Because the source is just a newspaper article published recently. Newspapers may be a good source for recent events, but the events from such a remote history should be covered by scholarly sources, if they took place. There has been enough time for those to be written. --[[user:Irpen|Irpen]] 21:10, 16 June 2008 (UTC) :*Good newspapers, like Rzeczpospolita, also tend to hire out such articles to reliable historians or journalists specializing in historical articles. For example, most of this issue was written by historian [[Andrzej Nieuważny]] ([http://www.his.uni.torun.pl/wydzial/instkat/historia/zaklady/hxix/an.html]).--[[User:Piotrus|Piotr Konieczny aka Prokonsul Piotrus]]|[[User_talk:Piotrus| talk ]] 21:17, 16 June 2008 (UTC) :::Well, if the author of the source is am accomplished historian whose credentials are independently established, I don't mind that this particular paper used as a source is from a newspaper (or even his personal web-site.) But just to avoid such confusion in the future, could you please add the author's name to the reference? That would solve the problem. --[[user:Irpen|Irpen]] 21:24, 16 June 2008 (UTC) ==B-class== For WP:POLAND per milhist asessment. --[[User:Piotrus|Piotr Konieczny aka Prokonsul Piotrus]]|[[User talk:Piotrus| talk to me]] 17:50, 31 May 2012 (UTC) {{Talk:Siege of Mantua (1799)/GA1}}
